channel.title: Java, Again
channel.description: I cannot seem to get my Ok Button to load more questions like at them moment i have a question which is what is your name then i added a text feild. But i have no idea on how to make the label and text feild change to something else after each time i click 'Ok' Anyone mind helping?

item.title: Java, Again
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

You are going to need to give the Button an ActionListener. Then, each time the button is clicked, call:
label1.setText("");
to set the text of a label again.

You can look at this to get an example, a bad example on my part, but i’m not releasing this project until it is completely finished.
http://pastebin.com/zycLabdt

Read full topic

item.title: Java, Again
item.dc:creator: @PLayRooney PLayRooney
item.description:
@PLayRooney wrote:

I understand, Next Time i’ll do this.

Read full topic

item.title: Java, Again
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

If you post your question in an intelligent and legitimate way, the odds of some people trolling you will go down.

The way youve posted the question right now would leave you open to trolls, what you should do is describe what tool or function you are trying to make and then describe the problem with it, after that display a snippet and what not of the “Ok” button and ask if anyone can help you fix it and improve it.

The bottom line is, if you ask your question in a stupid and noobish way, people wont take you seriously and reply with an idiotic answer, but do keep in mind someone is going to post an idiotic answer regardless.

Read full topic

item.description:

And get Trolled? i’d prefer post here and wait a day for a legitiment answer.
